title: Guiyang Forest Wild Animal Zoo trainer filmed riding on tiger's back | Metro News
text:
Toby Meyjes for Metro.co.uk Thursday 16 Feb 2017 4:02 pm The trainer was pictured sitting on a tiger in the footage (Picture: AsiaWire) 
A zoo has launched an investigation after one of its animal trainers was filmed sitting on a tiger and pulling its tail. 
In one piece of footage the trainer from Guiyang Forest Wild Animal Zoo in China appears to forcibly drag the animal by its tail as it tries to get away. Donald Trump attacks 'mess at home and abroad' during rare press conference 
At another point, the trainer can be seen trying to ride on the back of the big cat which has a metal ring around it’s neck. 
He also appears to be teasing the tiger, in footage that has is reported to have angered many online. 
According to People’s Daily China , the trainer told reporters that the park did not oppose his conduct and he would continue to post videos online. But the zoo is understood to have launched an investigation into the man’s conduct. More
